explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses the limitations of traditional machine learning methods in credit risk assessment and explores deep learning models as an alternative.
explanations.deep learning: The paper proposes a hybrid deep learning model (TCN-DilateFormer) for corporate credit risk assessment, indicating a focus on deep learning techniques.
explanations.neural network: The proposed model combines Transformer and CNN, both of which are types of neural networks.
explanations.convolutional neural network: The paper mentions the use of CNN (Convolutional Neural Network) in the hybrid model for processing local features.
explanations.CNN: Abbreviation for Convolutional Neural Network, which is explicitly mentioned in the abstract as part of the hybrid model.
explanations.attention mechanism: The Transformer component of the hybrid model inherently uses attention mechanisms, which are crucial for handling long-distance dependencies in data.
